MtkWriteEnviFile.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*===========================================================================
00002 =                                                                           =
00003 =                             MtkWriteEnviFile                              =
00004 =                                                                           =
00005 =============================================================================
00006 
00007                          Jet Propulsion Laboratory
00008                                    MISR
00009                                MISR Toolkit
00010 
00011             Copyright 2005, California Institute of Technology.
00012                            ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
00013                  U.S. Government Sponsorship acknowledged.
00014 
00015 ============================================================================*/
00016 
00017 #include "MisrWriteData.h"
00018 #include "MisrError.h"
00019 #include "MisrUtil.h"
00020 #include "MisrUnitConv.h"
00021 #include <string.h>
00022 #include <stdio.h>
00023 #include <math.h>
00024 
00031 MTKt_status MtkWriteEnviFile(
00032   const char *envifilename,  
00033   MTKt_DataBuffer buf,       
00034   MTKt_MapInfo mapinfo,      
00035   const char *misrfilename,  
00036   const char *misrgridname,  
00037   const char *misrfieldname   )
00038 {
00039   FILE *fp;         /* File pointer */
00040   char hdrfname[300];       /* ENVI Filename plus extension */
00041   char imgfname[300];       /* ENVI Filename plus extension */
00042   int idl_datatype[MTKd_NDATATYPE] = { 0, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 12, 3, 13, 14, 15, 4, 5 };
00043                 /* IDL/MTK Datatype mapping - 
00044                    1=8 bit byte;
00045                    2=16-bit signed integer; 
00046                    3=32-bit signed long integer; 
00047                    4=32-bit floating point; 
00048                    5=64-bit double precision floating point; 
00049                    6=2x32-bit complex, real-imaginary pair of double precision; 
00050                    9=2x64-bit double precision complex, real-imaginary pair of double precision; 
00051                    12=16-bit unsigned integer; 
00052                    13=32-bit unsigned long integer; 
00053                    14=64-bit signed long integer; and 
00054                    15=64-bit unsigned long integer. */
00055   double a, b, e2;      /* Ellipsoid semi-major axis, semi-minor axis, 
00056                    and eccentricity squared */
00057   double IncAng, AscLong;   /* Inclination angle and Longitude of ascending node (dd) */
00058   double x0, y0;        /* False Easting and False Northing (dd) */
00059   double PSRev, LRat;       /* Satellite revolution and Landsat Ratio (dd) */
00060   int endian = 1;       /* Endian test */
00061   char *endian_ptr = (char *)&endian;
00062 
00063   if (envifilename == NULL)
00064     return MTK_NULLPTR;
00065 
00066   /* Write binary file */
00067 
00068   strcpy(imgfname, envifilename);
00069   strcat(imgfname, ".img");
00070   if ((fp = fopen(imgfname, "wb")) == NULL) {
00071     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Error opening binfile");
00072   }
00073   fwrite(buf.dataptr, buf.datasize, buf.nline * buf.nsample, fp);
00074   fclose(fp);
00075 
00076 
00077   /* Write hdr file */
00078 
00079   strcpy(hdrfname, envifilename);
00080   strcat(hdrfname, ".hdr");
00081   if ((fp = fopen(hdrfname, "wb")) == NULL) {
00082     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Error opening hdrfile");
00083   }
00084 
00085   fprintf(fp, "ENVI\n");
00086   fprintf(fp, "description = {%s}\n", misrfilename);
00087   fprintf(fp, "samples = %d\n", buf.nsample);
00088   fprintf(fp, "lines = %d\n", buf.nline);
00089   fprintf(fp, "bands = 1\n");
00090   fprintf(fp, "header offset = 0\n");
00091   fprintf(fp, "file type = ENVI Standard\n");
00092   fprintf(fp, "data type = %d\n", idl_datatype[buf.datatype]);
00093   fprintf(fp, "interleave = bsq\n");
00094   fprintf(fp, "sensor type = MISR\n");
00095   if (endian_ptr[0] == 1)
00096     fprintf(fp,"byte order = 0\n");
00097   else
00098     fprintf(fp,"byte order = 1\n");
00099 
00100   fprintf(fp, "x start = 0.0\n");
00101   fprintf(fp, "y start = 0.0\n");
00102 
00103   fprintf(fp, "map info = {");
00104   fprintf(fp, "Space Oblique Mercator A (MISR Path %d), ", mapinfo.path);
00105   fprintf(fp, "1.0, ");
00106   fprintf(fp, "1.0, ");
00107   fprintf(fp, "%f, ", mapinfo.som.ulc.x);
00108   fprintf(fp, "%f, ", mapinfo.som.ulc.y);
00109   fprintf(fp, "%f, ", (float)mapinfo.resolution);
00110   fprintf(fp, "%f, ", (float)mapinfo.resolution);
00111   fprintf(fp, "WGS-84, ");
00112   fprintf(fp, "units=Meters, ");
00113   fprintf(fp, "rotation=90.0");
00114   fprintf(fp, "}\n");
00115 
00116   /* Convert eccentricity fo the ellipsoid to b parameter */
00117   a = mapinfo.pp.projparam[0];
00118   e2 = mapinfo.pp.projparam[1];
00119   e2 = fabs(e2);
00120   b = sqrt(pow(a,2) - e2 * pow(a,2));
00121   /* Convert from packed DMS to decimal degrees */
00122   MtkDmsToDd(mapinfo.pp.projparam[3], &IncAng);
00123   MtkDmsToDd(mapinfo.pp.projparam[4], &AscLong);
00124   PSRev = mapinfo.pp.projparam[8];
00125   MtkDmsToDd(mapinfo.pp.projparam[9], &LRat);
00126   /* No false easting or false northing */
00127   x0 = 0.0;
00128   y0 = 0.0;
00129   /* Apparently Envi uses 37 for generic SOM A - see ENVI's map_proj.txt */
00130 
00131   fprintf(fp, "projection info = {");
00132   fprintf(fp, "37, ");
00133   fprintf(fp, "%f, ", a);
00134   fprintf(fp, "%f, ", b);
00135   fprintf(fp, "%f, ", IncAng);
00136   fprintf(fp, "%f, ", AscLong);
00137   fprintf(fp, "%f, ", x0);
00138   fprintf(fp, "%f, ", y0);
00139   fprintf(fp, "%f, ", PSRev);
00140   fprintf(fp, "%f, ", LRat);
00141   fprintf(fp, "WGS-84, ");
00142   fprintf(fp, "Space Oblique Mercator A (MISR Path %d), ", mapinfo.path);
00143   fprintf(fp, "units=Meters");
00144   fprintf(fp, "}\n");
00145 
00146   fprintf(fp, "pixel size = {");
00147   fprintf(fp, "%f, ", (float)mapinfo.resolution);
00148   fprintf(fp, "%f, ", (float)mapinfo.resolution);
00149   fprintf(fp, "units=Meters");
00150   fprintf(fp, "}\n");
00151 
00152   fprintf(fp, "band names = {");
00153   fprintf(fp, "%s:%s", misrgridname, misrfieldname);
00154   fprintf(fp, "}\n");
00155 
00156   fclose(fp);
00157 
00158   return MTK_SUCCESS;
00159 ERROR_HANDLE:
00160   return MTK_FAILURE;
00161 }
